rtega_mnemonic:
囚囚RSprisoner, convict, confine

purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A person 人 in a cell 囗
purpleculture_examples:
囚犯 [ qiú fàn ]: prisoner; convict
囚禁 [ qiú jìn ]: to imprison; captivity
囚徒 [ qiú tú ]: prisoner
死囚 [ sǐ qiú ]: prisoner that awaits execution; convict sentenced to death; someone on death row
囚笼 [ qiú lóng ]: cage used to hold or transport prisoners

    • 人 [ rén ] man, person; people
heisig_chinese_memo: A person pent in is obviously captured and a prisoner. Imagine a man put inside a wooden box, his evil capturers waiting for ransom money.
koohiiStory1: A person pent in is obviously captured. Imagine a man put inside a wooden box, his evil capturers waiting for ransom money.
koohiiStory2: Mr. T can´t be captured. This kanji is lying.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Inside this giant mouth is a person, trapped, because they're a criminal. They did something bad (they touched the mouth of another person without consent) and now they're in mouth jail for criminals.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the criminal, trapped inside the mouth. They don't even look sorry!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The criminal is only wearing shoes (しゅう). They're completely naked otherwise. They have to wear shoes because the mouth jail would be too slippery for them to stand otherwise.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Wearing nothing but shoes is also really uncomfortable too, so it's actually part of the criminal's punishment. They don't seem to know that though.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (人) in the box (囗) is a prisoner
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A person pent in is obviously captured and a prisoner. Imagine a man put inside a wooden box, his evil capturers waiting for ransom money.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Prisoner " is an understanding word. From the perspective of human beings, the original meaning is detention or imprisonment. "Shuowen": "Prisoners, the line is also, from the people in the middle." Interpretation: "Prisoner, detention." For example, "Shang Shu. "The Life of Cai Zhong" "Prisoner Cai Shu Yu Guo Lin", "Confucius": "Prisoner, that is to control his access." "Zuo Zhuan. Nine Years of Cheng Gong: "Ju People Prisoner Chu Gong Ziping." "Historical Records. "Yin Benji": "The prisoner of Xibo Yili."

" Prisoner " is extended to imprisoned persons, such as captives and prisoners. Such as "Poetry. Lu Song. "Pan Shui" "Presenting Prisoners in Pan", Zheng Xuan wrote: "Prisoners, those captured." "Han Shu. Shihuo Zhi: "The emperor is Shandong Budan, and he pardons the prisoners of the world."
203 Characters
humanum_short_description_en: " Prisoner " is an understanding word. From the perspective of human beings, the original meaning is imprisonment or imprisonment, and it is extended to imprisoned persons, such as prisoners and prisoners.
humanum_full_description:
「囚」是會意字，從人在囗中，本義是拘禁、關押。《說文》：「囚，繫也，从人在囗中。」《爾雅．釋言》：「囚，拘也。」例如《尚書．蔡仲之命》「囚蔡叔于郭鄰」，《孔傳》：「囚，謂制其出入。」《左傳．成公九年》：「莒人囚楚公子平。」《史記．殷本紀》：「紂囚西伯羑里。」

　　「囚」引申為被拘禁的人，如俘虜、犯人。如《詩．魯頌．泮水》「在泮獻囚」，鄭玄箋：「囚，所虜獲者。」《漢書．食貨志》：「天子為山東不澹，赦天下囚。」
203 Characters
humanum_short_description: 「囚」是會意字，從人在囗中，本義是拘禁、關押，引申為被拘禁的人，如俘虜、犯人。

「 囚 」是會意字，從人在囗中，本義是拘禁、關押。《說文》：「囚，繫也，从人在囗中。」《爾雅．釋言》：「囚，拘也。」例如《尚書．蔡仲之命》「囚蔡叔于郭鄰」，《孔傳》：「囚，謂制其出入。」《左傳．成公九年》：「莒人囚楚公子平。」《史記．殷本紀》：「紂囚西伯羑里。」 「 囚 」引申為被拘禁的人，如俘虜、犯人。如《詩．魯頌．泮水》「在泮獻囚」，鄭玄箋：「囚，所虜獲者。」《漢書．食貨志》：「天子為山東不澹，赦天下囚。」 203 Characters

Nine Years of Cheng Gong: "Ju People Prisoner Chu Gong Ziping." "Historical Records. "Yin Benji": "The prisoner of Xibo Yili." 囚字的基本解释

囚
qiú
拘禁：囚禁。囚车。囚牢。
被拘禁的人：囚犯。囚徒。死囚。囚首垢面。

囚字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiú］
［《廣韻》似由切，平尤，邪。］
(1)拘禁；幽禁。
(2)被围困。
(3)束缚；局限。
(4)俘获。
(5)指被俘获的敌人。
(6)犯人。
(7)指犯人的罪案。

囚字的英文翻译

◎ 囚
convict, imprison, prisoner

囚字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【囗字部】　囚； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页216第20
【唐韻】似由切【集韻】【韻會】徐由切，?音遒。【說文】繫也。从人，在囗中。【爾雅·釋言】拘也。【風俗通】遒也。辭窮情得，以罪誅遒也。【周禮·秋官·掌囚註】囚，拘也。主拘繫當?殺者。又【掌囚】掌守盜賊。凡囚者，上罪梏拲而桎，中罪桎梏，下罪梏。【註】拲者，兩手共一木也。中罪不拲，手足各一木。下罪又去桎。　又罪人也。【禮·月令】挺重囚，益其食。【註】挺，拔出之意。重囚禁繫嚴密，故特加寬，益其食也。　又獄辭亦曰囚。【書·康誥】丕蔽要囚。【註】要囚，獄詞之要者。蔽，斷也，爲囚求生道也。　又【詩·魯頌】在泮獻囚。【註】囚，所鹵䉟者。　又叶似魚切，音徐。【王逸·九思】白龍兮見射，靈龜兮執拘。仲尼兮困阨，鄒衍兮幽囚。

囚字的源字形

囚字的起名意思

暂无。

Prisoners
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiú］
["Guangyun" seems to be cut, flat, and evil. ]
(1) Confinement; confinement.
(2) Besiege.
(3) Restraint; limitation.
(4) Capture.
(5) Refers to the captured enemy.
(6) Prisoner.
(7) Refers to crimes committed by criminals.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [囗字部] 　 prisoner; Kangxi strokes: 5; page number: page 216 to 20
[Tang Yun] Like Youqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Xu Youqie,? Yinqie. [Said the text] Department also. From the person, in the 囗. 【Erya·Interpretation】Juye. 【Customs and Customs】Early. To resign from poverty, to punish you with sin. [Zhou Li·Qiuguan·Prisoner's Note] Prisoners, detentions. The main detainee should be the killer. [Prisoner] guards the thieves. All prisoners are shackled by sin, shackled by sin, and shackled by sin. [Note] For those who squeeze, there is a wood in both hands. He is not guilty, and his hands and feet have a tree. Offend and go to shackles.　Sinner again. 【Rite·Yueling】Heavy prisoners and benefit their food. [Note] Ting, meaning to pull out. The heavy imprisonment system is tight, so it is specially widened to benefit its food.　The sentence of prison is also a prisoner. 【Book·Kang Gao】Pi concealed a prisoner. [Note] To be a prisoner, the important person in prison terms. Shield, break, and survive for prisoners.　[Poetry·Lu Song] in Pan offering prisoners. [Note] Prisoners, those who are halogenated.　The leaves are like fish cut again, the sound is Xu. 【Wang Yi·Nine Thoughts】The white dragon sees and shoots, the spirit turtle is detained. Zhong Nixi is in distress, Zou Yanxi is the prisoner.

起来,本义是“拘禁”,如《尚书》:
“囚蔡叔于郭邻”。也指“被拘禁的

так как

Изображение персонажа использует тюрьму для заключения человека в тюрьму, первоначальное значение - «заключение», например «Шаншу»: «Заключенный Цай Шу Юй Гуо Линь».
Также имеется в виду «задержанные - заключенные», например «Книга песен»: «Приношение заключенных в зарубежных странах».
люди"-
qiú
I гл.
арестовать, схватить; заключить в тюрьму
把他囚起来 бросить его в тюрьму
II сущ.
1) арестант, заключённый; узник
录囚 регистрировать заключённых
2) пленный, пленник
献囚 приводить (представлять) пленных
Radicals: 口, 人  (mouth, person)
Meaning Mnemonic
Inside this giant mouth is a person, trapped, because they're a criminal. They did something bad (they touched the mouth of another person without consent) and now they're in mouth jail for criminals.
Picture the criminal, trapped inside the mouth. They don't even look sorry!
Reading Mnemonic
The criminal is only wearing shoes (しゅう). They're completely naked otherwise. They have to wear shoes because the mouth jail would be too slippery for them to stand otherwise.
Wearing nothing but shoes is also really uncomfortable too, so it's actually part of the criminal's punishment. They don't seem to know that though.
